title: Help me out of elo hell Riot
body: I love playing support, i main bard, and i keep getting S-, S, S+ but cant get past Gold V, i keep getting shitty teams and get demoted back to Silver. Should i just stop playing support or do you have anything to say about this, cuz im getting tired of getting demoted and promoted.

replies.body: Silver/gold is probably the easiest elo to climb. You need to get better at the game to be able to climb.

In order to demote, your MMR has to be really bad. You must have been playing against mid-silvers. If you can't climb against mid-silvers, you need to improve your own gameplay. Please note that I'm not attacking you, but I feel like someone has to point it out.

"These shitty teams"
what if I told you, you never get out of Elo hell, you only go higher in it?

I see you picking Ivern in ranked, deserved. Also you should really be getting 45% cdr, max e second, and mobies as fast as possible to roam and have an impact earlier. It also helps you get chimes faster.

Thats my point bud.

Nobody cares.

Find a good jungler or ADC to duo with. If I were you, I'd avoid playing support solo.

Of course, you could've played better, too. Never put 100% of the blame on your team, always make sure you're looking at yourself as a play and accessing how you can improve.

I started my journey as a bronze V and it took me nearly 2 years to crawl my way up to Plat, and I did it with the mindset that EVERY loss I ever had wasn't my teams fault. There was always something I could do better, and that's how I kept improving.
